command: iptables -I INPUT -m recent --name t1205_wol --rcheck --seconds 60 -p tcp --dport 2223 -j ACCEPT; iptables -I INPUT -p udp --dport 9 -m string --hex-string "|ffffffffffff|" -m recent --name t1205_wol --set -j LOG --log-prefix "T1205-WOL-SIGNAL "; nc -l -p 2223 -k >/dev/null 2>&1 &
explanation: Uses a Wake-on-LAN style magic packet pattern (six 0xFF bytes) on UDP/9 as the signal. The firewall logs and adds the source to a recent list, opening TCP/2223 for 60s where nc listens. Illustrates network-level signaling via WoL characteristics.
rationale_steps: Detect WoL magic frame signature at the firewall
Log unusual UDP/9 broadcasts/unicasts for detection
Permit gated access to a hidden service after WoL-style signal
